that's implemented in CE and left to the OEM to build up as they see fit and
essentially it allows three modes of operation if it's turned on it verifies a digital signature it
may allow the code to not run at all it may allow the code to run in what's
called non-trusted mode and it may allow the code to run in trusted mode the difference being
that our research has indicated that the difference between non-trusted mode and trusted mode is not as is not very
significant uh trusted mode allows the full access to all apis on C e
non-trusted mode has a a significant restrictions on the number of system calls you can make but our research has
